episodeTitle: Legend of the Rainbow Mist! Ruluka Island and the Old Man Henzo!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates escape from a Marine fleet and dock at Ruluka Island, where they encounter oppressive taxation and meet Professor Henzo, a scientist researching the mysterious Rainbow Mist phenomenon. When the mist appears, Henzo takes the Going Merry to investigate, searching for friends who disappeared fifty years ago.

events.title: Marine Chase by Rapanui Pasqua's Fleet
events.description: The Going Merry is pursued by Lieutenant Commander Rapanui Pasqua's fleet of 9 Marine ships. The Straw Hat Pirates are forced to navigate through dangerous waters while being hunted by the Marines.
events.significance: Introduces the episode's initial conflict and establishes Rapanui Pasqua as a Marine officer, though his true identity as one of Henzo's childhood friends is not yet revealed.

quotes.text: Everyone, we need to speed ahead and escape these Marine ships!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami directs the crew to evade the Marine pursuit

events.title: Rapanui's Finger Bomb Technique
events.description: Lieutenant Commander Rapanui Pasqua demonstrates his signature technique, the Finger Bomb, by flinging a coin at high speed with his bare fingers. However, he sneezes during the attack, causing the coin to hit one of his own Marine ships instead of the Going Merry.
events.significance: Introduces Rapanui's unique fighting ability and provides comic relief while allowing the Straw Hats to escape due to the broken Marine formation.

quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Rapanui attempts to use his signature technique but sneezes mid-attack

events.title: Arrival at Ruluka Island
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates dock at Ruluka Island after escaping the Marine pursuit. The crew disembarks to explore the island, immediately noticing the imposing Rainbow Tower structure.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Ruluka Island Arc and introduces the main location for this filler storyline.

events.title: Ruluka's Oppressive Taxation System
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates encounter Ruluka Island's corrupt taxation system where the Mayor and his men have placed high taxes on everything, including walking, breathing, and even looking at the Rainbow Tower. Chopper and other crew members are confronted by aggressive tax collectors.
events.significance: Establishes the corrupt government of Ruluka Island and creates immediate conflict between the Straw Hats and the island's authorities, setting up the arc's themes of oppression and corruption.

events.title: Henzo's First Appearance
events.description: Robin, Usopp, and Luffy meet Professor Henzo, an elderly scientist with a distinctive mustache and lab coat. He introduces himself as a researcher studying the Rainbow Mist phenomenon and shows immediate interest when Robin mentions her knowledge of the legend.
events.significance: Introduces the main guest character of the arc whose personal quest drives the storyline. Henzo's character embodies themes of loyalty, perseverance, and the passage of time.

quotes.text: I'm Professor Henzo, and I've dedicated my life to researching the Rainbow Mist.
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo introduces himself to the Straw Hats

events.title: The Rainbow Mist Legend
events.description: Henzo explains the legend of the Rainbow Mist, a mysterious phenomenon that appears near Ruluka Island. Robin reveals she has read about it, and Henzo provides detailed information about the mist's properties and the stories surrounding it.
events.significance: Establishes the central mystery of the arc and provides the mythological foundation for the storyline. The Rainbow Mist serves as both a natural phenomenon and a plot device for time displacement.

quotes.text: The Rainbow Mist is a mysterious phenomenon that has been documented in legends throughout history.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin shares her knowledge about the Rainbow Mist

events.title: Henzo's Lost Friends
events.description: Henzo reveals that fifty years ago, he had five childhood friends—Rapanui, Isoka, Akibi, Rongo, and Pukau—who disappeared into the Rainbow Mist and never returned. He explains how they were planning to become pirates together when Wetton attacked their town, forcing them to flee on a ship.
events.significance: Provides Henzo's emotional motivation for his lifelong research and establishes the personal stakes of the arc. This backstory connects to the present conflict and explains Henzo's desperate determination.

quotes.text: My friends disappeared into that mist fifty years ago, and I've been searching for them ever since.
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo reveals his motivation for researching the Rainbow Mist

events.title: Henzo's Sacrifice
events.description: Through flashback, Henzo recounts how he sacrificed himself during the escape from Wetton's attack, falling into the sea so his friends could escape. While he survived and was left behind, his friends sailed into the Rainbow Mist and vanished.
events.significance: Demonstrates Henzo's selfless character and explains why he was separated from his friends. His survival while they disappeared creates the tragedy that drives his fifty-year quest.

events.title: The Tarielishin's Return
events.description: A mysterious ship, the Tarielishin, drifts into Ruluka harbor completely unmanned. Henzo recognizes it as the same ship his friends used fifty years ago, noting that it appears exactly as it did on the day it disappeared with no signs of aging or deterioration.
events.significance: Provides concrete evidence of the Rainbow Mist's time-distorting properties and gives Henzo hope that his friends might still be alive somewhere. The preserved state of the ship suggests time operates differently within the mist.

quotes.text: This is the Tarielishin... It's exactly as it was fifty years ago!
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo discovers his friends' ship has returned unchanged

events.title: Henzo Steals the Going Merry
events.description: When Henzo detects that the Rainbow Mist is appearing, he rushes to the docks and commandeers the Going Merry without permission. Driven by desperation after waiting fifty years for this opportunity, he sails directly into the mysterious mist to search for his lost friends.
events.significance: Creates the episode's climactic conflict and forces the Straw Hat Pirates to pursue Henzo into the Rainbow Mist. His desperate action demonstrates how far he'll go to reunite with his friends and sets up the adventure for subsequent episodes.

quotes.text: I've waited fifty years for this moment! I won't let this chance slip away!
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo explains his actions as he takes the Going Merry into the Rainbow Mist

events.title: Entering the Rainbow Mist
events.description: The Going Merry, with Henzo aboard, sails into the Rainbow Mist as the Straw Hat Pirates watch from the shore. The ship disappears into the swirling, colorful fog, leaving the crew to decide whether to pursue and rescue their vessel.
events.significance: Ends the episode on a cliffhanger and establishes the Rainbow Mist as an active location that the crew must navigate in future episodes. The visual spectacle of the mist emphasizes its otherworldly nature.

quotes.text: I've waited fifty years for this moment! I won't let this chance slip away!
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo's determination as he takes the Going Merry into the Rainbow Mist

quotes.text: My friends disappeared into that mist fifty years ago, and I've been searching for them ever since.
quotes.speaker: Henzo
quotes.context: Henzo explains his lifelong quest to the Straw Hats

themes.description: Henzo's fifty-year quest to find his lost friends demonstrates unwavering loyalty and the enduring power of friendship across time. His dedication shows how true bonds transcend decades.
themes.symbolism: The Rainbow Mist represents the barrier between Henzo and his friends, while the unchanged Tarielishin symbolizes how some friendships remain frozen in time.

themes.description: The episode explores how time affects people differently, with Henzo aging fifty years while his friends remain trapped in the past. The theme examines nostalgia, loss, and the passage of time.
themes.symbolism: The preserved state of the Tarielishin ship represents memories that remain pristine despite the passage of time.

themes.description: Ruluka Island's exploitative taxation system represents governmental corruption and the abuse of power. The Mayor's greed funds his own interests at the expense of the common people.
themes.symbolism: The Rainbow Tower looms over the island, symbolizing the oppressive presence of corrupt authority.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a dedicated scientist consumed by a fifty-year quest to reunite with his childhood friends. His character embodies themes of loyalty, sacrifice, and perseverance. Despite his age and the passage of time, his determination remains unshaken.
keyActions: Introduces himself to Robin, Luffy, and Usopp
Reveals his backstory about lost friends
Steals the Going Merry to enter the Rainbow Mist
quotes: I've waited fifty years for this moment! I won't let this chance slip away!
My friends disappeared into that mist fifty years ago, and I've been searching for them ever since.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's knowledge of the Rainbow Mist legend makes her instrumental in understanding the phenomenon. She serves as the intellectual bridge between the Straw Hats and Henzo's research.
keyActions: Shares knowledge about the Rainbow Mist from her readings
Engages with Henzo about his research
Helps the crew understand the situation
quotes: The Rainbow Mist is a mysterious phenomenon that has been documented in legends throughout history.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ruluka Island Arc is anime-original filler content with no manga counterpart. This arc was created to provide buffer time between the Alabasta Arc and Jaya Arc.

trivia.fact: Episode 139 is the first episode of the Ruluka Island Arc, which was the last filler arc dubbed by 4Kids Entertainment before they discontinued the series.
The Ruluka Island Arc takes place chronologically after the Alabasta Arc while the Straw Hats are sailing toward Jaya Island, filling the gap before the Sky Island Saga begins.
Rapanui Pasqua's name is derived from 'Rapa Nui' and 'Pasqua,' both names for Easter Island in different languages (native and Spanish respectively).
This episode aired on January 5, 2003, in Japan and achieved a 16.2% viewership rating, ranking #1 for its timeslot.
The Rainbow Mist concept incorporates elements of time displacement and dimensional anomalies, themes that would later be explored in canon arcs of One Piece.
The ending theme 'Free Will' by Ruppina features Nico Robin prominently in its animation, showing glimpses of her past before her official backstory in the Enies Lobby Arc.
